title.narrative: 2.1 CHILD SENSITIVE SOCIAL PROTEC - SPG

description.narrative: Strengthened national capacity to develop, budget, and operationalize social protection measures that respond to multi-dimensional child poverty and vulnerabilities, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Economic And Social Policy General, Reducing Child Poverty, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, social protection measures are more equitable and inclusive and there is a functioning child protection system, staffed by qualified service providers

sector.narrative: Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
Expanding and improving cash transfers for children
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strengthened national capacity to develop, budget, and operationalize social protection measures that respond to multi-dimensionalchild poverty and vulnerabilities

description.narrative: Enhanced commitment by the Government of Viet Nam to child rights was reflected through the issuance of the revised Decree No. 20/2021 on the expansion of coverage and the adequacy of social assistance for children, especially those aged 0-3 years. UNICEF provided technical support to prioritize children in the social assistance response to COVID-19, and advocated the importance of child-sensitive, shock-responsive and gender-responsive social assistance. | Status:Met | As-of Date:03/02/2022

title.narrative: Shock-responsive SP: Shock-responsive SP: Policy/strategy is adapted to support appropriate and timely vertical and/or horizontal expansion expansion of the existing social protection systems during crisis by government and/or humanitarian agencies (Linking with early warning systems, climate change and resilience building policies, contingency budgeting and financing etc.)

baseline.value: 1-SP policy or strategy in place, but no adaptation to make it shock responsive

target.value: 2020:SP policy in place and partially adapted to be shock-responsive

actual.value: 2019:Policy options on child focused shock- reponsisve social protection are available.

title.narrative: Policy/Strategy: An Action Plan for implementation of the National Master Plan on Social Assistance reform and Development for 2017-2025 and Vision to 2030 is available and operational(52439)
National government measurement of child poverty using multidimensional measures

baseline.value: Score 3: There is a child poverty measurement supported by the government but is not routinely measured.

target.value: 2021:Score 4: There is a child poverty measurement supported by the government and is routinely monitored.
